answers.answer: My sister had her baby at 35 weeks he was 5lbs he had to stay about a week in nicu he had a little trouble breathing but he's a big 1year old now and no problems
thanks for letting me know , so worried i know should be grateful got this  far

My second son was born at 35 1/2 weeks, he was still over 7lbs but his lungs weren't quite developed fully.  He scared us for a few days and ended up in NICU for 11 days, but he is a very healthy normal 8 year old now.  Also one of my best friends had her son about the same time and he was fine and went home at a normal time.  Is your baby a boy or girl? I have heard that boys have slightly more trouble, but your baby could come out just fine!
Having a lil boy I just hope he can stay till at least 36 to give him extra time. Although these.tablets make.me feel awful I would take then as long need too

Mt first was born at 34w4d ans even though she was 7lb6oz she wasn't breathing.when she was born and had to stay under a hood for a few days and was real jaundice. Total hospital stay was about 1 1/2 weeks. They told me she would develop slower than other kids and would get sickee more often. And I'm proud to say she is the healthiest and most active of all my kids and she is 11 reading at a 12thladies grade reading level! She is truly amazing!

My daughter was 34 weeks 5 days when she was born and she was 6lbs 4oz. She needed assistance breathing so she was on a c-pap, but only for about a day. She was in the NICU for a week because her feed had to be high enough before she could get discharged from there, an IV made up the rest of the nutrients while she was in the NICU. For about a year or so she was more sensitive to bright light and loud noises because she was premature. She will now be 3 in April and she is a healthy very busy girl and has been developing just fine.

They will only induce you this early if you or baby are at severe risk. They know what's best and will do what gives you both the best chance of survival. You baby may need a couple of days with extra care but he will be absolutely fine hun. Trust the docs to do what's best for you both. Its a good thing you're organised and ready for his arrival!! :-) 36 is only a week shy of full term at the end of the day. Can't wait to read the update saying he's here and you're both doing well. Best of luck xx

My son was born at 36w. He was almost seven pounds and he stayed in the nicu for a week. He was in respiratory distress and his lung collapsed shortly after birth. He's now six weeks and as of last week was just barely over his birth weight. Overall he's healthy and doing well now.

question: how many of u had babies born betwen35-36 weeks,how were they ,did they stay in for long? only asking as maybe induced in the next week due to preeclampsia
title: babies born between 35-36 weeks
